meanings.definition: Capable of being obtained or reached.
meanings.sent1: The library books are getatable for everyone to borrow.
meanings.sent2: The fresh fruits at the market are getatable for purchase.
meanings.sent3: The cookies on the top shelf were getatable only to the tallest person in the room.
meanings.sent4: The treasure chest buried in the sand was getatable after a long search.
meanings.sent5: The key to the locked door was finally getatable after hours of searching.

meanings.sent1: The park is getatable to all visitors during the day.
meanings.sent2: The information on the website is getatable to anyone with internet access.
meanings.sent3: The last piece of cake was getatable only to those who arrived early.
meanings.sent4: The solution to the problem became getatable after careful consideration.
meanings.sent5: The emergency exit was clearly getatable in case of a fire.
